intro: Pediomelum mephiticum, commonly known as the stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is released when the leaves are crushed. Pediomelum mephiticum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
